weatherForecast.comment: Due to a foehn-driven SW air current, dense clouds will accumulate on Saturday, the summits often be shrouded in fog. During the course of the day, light precipitation. Moderate to strong SW winds, gusts reaching 60 km/hr. At 1000m: +6 degrees; at 2000m: 0 degrees; at 3000m: -4 degrees. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.highlights: Slightly rising danger of moist/wet avalanches due to rainfall. Caution: weak layers in old snow.
avalancheActivity.comment: Due to rainfall, increasingly frequent moist/wet-snow avalanches are possible, esp. below 2000m, on very steep slopes in all aspects. Releases are relatively small and can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier. Such danger zones lie on very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls above 2000m and can reach medium size.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some rainfall below 2000m, and some snowfall, esp. at high altitudes. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is nearly absent. The snowpack is moist.  In the lowermost part of the snowpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. above 2000.

weatherForecast.comment: Due to a foehn-driven SW air current, dense clouds will accumulate on Saturday, the summits often be shrouded in fog. During the course of the day, light precipitation. Moderate to strong SW winds, gusts reaching 60 km/hr. At 1000m: +6 degrees; at 2000m: 0 degrees; at 3000m: -4 degrees. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution:  weak layers in the old snow
avalancheActivity.comment: Weak layers can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier. Such danger zones lie on N/W/E facing very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls above 2200m. Very isolated danger zones also occur on very steep sunny slopes above 2600m. Avalanches can in isolated cases reach medium size. Due to snowpack moistening, isolated moist loose-snow avalanches are possible, esp. on very steep slopes, small releases.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some rainfall, and some snowfall, esp. at high altitudes. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is nearly absent. The snowpack is moist, esp. below 2500m.  In the middle part of the snowpack on N/W/E facing slopes there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. above 2200m.

weatherForecast.comment: Due to a foehn-driven SW air current, dense clouds will accumulate on Saturday, the summits often be shrouded in fog. During the course of the day, light precipitation. Moderate to strong SW winds, gusts reaching 60 km/hr. At 1000m: +6 degrees; at 2000m: 0 degrees. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.highlights: Slightly rising danger of moist/wet avalanches due to rainfall. Caution: weak layers in old snow.
avalancheActivity.comment: Due to rainfall, increasingly frequent moist/wet-snow avalanches are possible, esp. on steep slopes in all aspects. Releases are relatively small and can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier. Such danger zones lie on very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls above 1900m and can reach medium size.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some rainfall, and some snowfall, esp. at high altitudes. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is nearly absent. The snowpack is moist.  In the lowermost part of the snowpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. at high altitudes.

weatherForecast.comment: Due to a foehn-driven SW air current, dense clouds will accumulate on Saturday, the summits often be shrouded in fog. Apart from summits, there will be bright intervals esp. in the eastern Gurktal Alps as far as Koralpe. During the course of the day, light precipitation. Moderate to strong SW winds, gusts reaching 60 km/hr. At 1000m: +6 degrees; at 2000m: 0 degrees; at 3000m: -4 degrees. Source: GeoSphere

avalancheActivity.comment: Moist/wet avalanches can be triggered in the old snow even by one sole skier in all aspecdts on very steep shady slopes and in transitions into gullies and bowls, esp at high altitudes. Isolated danger zones occur esp. on very steep shady slopes at high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Some rainfall below 2000m, and some snowfall, esp. at high altitudes. Nocturnal outgoing longwave radiation is nearly absent. The snowpack is moist.  In the lowermost part of the snowpack there are faceted, expansively metamorphosed weak layers evident, esp. above 2000.

customData.generalHeadline: Slightly rising danger of moist/wet avalanches
